subject: Fix deploy and teardown without node enrolment
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-22 17:03:45.000000000', 'message': "Fix deploy and teardown without node enrolment

If the ironic_config field is not present in a node definition, then
that node should not be registered with ironic. In this case we also
don't need to query glance for images or wait for resources to appear
in placement.

If nova_flavors is empty, we do not need to register flavors, so no need
to install the client or check for OS_USERNAME.

Also fixes an issue in the action plugin where it would fail if
ironic_config field is not present in a node definition.

Finally, in CI deploy/teardown tests, rather than skipping tasks, we now
remove the ironic_config field from the node definition, and set
nova_flavors to empty, such that we exercise these code paths.

Change-Id: I29b42665f1609c99e80f12ab6f3815d0e0918dae
Story: 2004412
Task: 28056

commit_message:
Fix deploy and teardown without node enrolment

If the ironic_config field is not present in a node definition, then
that node should not be registered with ironic. In this case we also
don't need to query glance for images or wait for resources to appear
in placement.

If nova_flavors is empty, we do not need to register flavors, so no need
to install the client or check for OS_USERNAME.

Also fixes an issue in the action plugin where it would fail if
ironic_config field is not present in a node definition.

Finally, in CI deploy/teardown tests, rather than skipping tasks, we now
remove the ironic_config field from the node definition, and set
nova_flavors to empty, such that we exercise these code paths.

Change-Id: I29b42665f1609c99e80f12ab6f3815d0e0918dae
Story: 2004412
Task: 28056

commit_message:
Fix physical network configuration on Dell switches

The dellos Ansible modules do not accept a `transport` key in the
provider parameter anymore, even in Ansible 2.4.0.

Change-Id: I4bdaa337cb9c6cb93f36338a191a9aa78e2c13f0
Story: 2004588
Task: 28464

commit_message:
Deprecate pki related options

check_revocations_for_cached and hash_algorithms are deprecated for
removel because of PKI token format is no longer supported.
Update warning message and add a release note.

Change-Id: I8cc64c8a0fdf002405e8cfdba178c3a6fcda5bab
Closes-Bug: #1804562
Closes-Bug: #1804720

[{'created': '2018-12-12 15:32:33.000000000', 'message': "Replace ThreadPoolExecutor with GreenThreadPoolExecutor

Based on eventlet issue [1] ThreadPoolExecutor doesn't play nice with
eventlet in python 3.7. We saw deadlocks in the functional-py37
execution in live migration tests due to live migration using
ThreadPoolExecutor.

The [1] suggests to replaces ThreadPoolExecutor with
futurist.GreenThreadPoolExecutor to avoid deadlocks. So this patch does
the replacement and adjusts the unit tests accordingly.

As the ThreadPoolExecutor was the last used class from the futures
module we remove that from the requirements and add the futurist module
instead.

[1] https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/508

commit_message:
Replace ThreadPoolExecutor with GreenThreadPoolExecutor

Based on eventlet issue [1] ThreadPoolExecutor doesn't play nice with
eventlet in python 3.7. We saw deadlocks in the functional-py37
execution in live migration tests due to live migration using
ThreadPoolExecutor.

The [1] suggests to replaces ThreadPoolExecutor with
futurist.GreenThreadPoolExecutor to avoid deadlocks. So this patch does
the replacement and adjusts the unit tests accordingly.

As the ThreadPoolExecutor was the last used class from the futures
module we remove that from the requirements and add the futurist module
instead.

[1] https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/508

Change-Id: Ia56ab43be739e677760bbad5c40caad924425fa5

commit_message:
Changes following becoming an official project

* Updates the documentation to use openstackdocstheme
* Try to make sphinx config more similar to other openstack projects
* Add publishing jobs for docs & release notes
* Update links to source and docs
* Add a version module

Change-Id: I5180e008382e294aa9808a4775e998776f21362a

commit_message:
Removed older version of python3.x

Remove the support of python3.4, because
in Ubuntu Xenial only (python3.4 is
restricted to <= Mitaka).

Closes-Bug:  #1801855

commit_message:
Add support for querying quotas with usage

The neutron HTTP API supports issuing a GET call
on /v2.0/quotas/{project_id}/details.json in order
to obtain quotas with usage information for a
given tenant. However, this capability is not
currently exposed in the python-neutronclient code.

Add path: quota_details_path
Add function show_quota_details

Closes-Bug: #1808451
Related-Bug: #1599488
Change-Id: Ia02172f62b9d9915273021627b0feb52a4f376da

commit_message:
DNM: Test jobs running on bionic instead of xenial

We want to migrate to the latest Ubuntu LTS release
18.04 aka Bionic. This is just a patch to find possible
issues for python-keystoneclient gate jobs before the real
migration starts.

python-keystoneclient has only one job which is derived
from 'devstack' base job which is migrated to Bionic
in Depends-On patch.

[0] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/devstack-bionic

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/610977
Change-Id: Ied76829eee685853c1b28fd468d7491542a8dc8f

commit_message:
Fix new mariadb ipv6 issue

It seems that pre 10.3 mariadb did not except square brackets when
setting the wsrep gcomm address, whereas 10.3 requires them.
Also 10.3 seems to have isssues binding to a specified ipv6 address.
For the time being, until we investigate more in detail, let's just
not bind an ip address for the the gcomm address when using ipv6.

This will unblock all promotions while we get to the bottom of the
issue.

Change-Id: I0b49019065c71edc4497c777f33af7926e8b1238
Closes-Bug: #1808536

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary entries in resource prefix map

The fix is trivial but the intent is to signal potential new
contributors that they don't need to populate this map if the prefix
is empty.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-14 15:45:35.000000000', 'message': "Dropping radvd process privileges

radvd needs to run as root, but has the capability to drop privileges on
linux hosts. Currently, radvd process is not using this feature and
this can be considered a serious risk.

In addition, some distributions like SUSE, radvd process runs as a non
privileged user by default, causing radvd failure to daemonize
because it can't write the pid in the corresponding neutron folder and
break the IPv6 functionality.

This patch allows radvd process to run with the same user used by
neutron. In order to allow this, it changes the radvd config file
permissions to 444 because radvd doesn't allow that this file can be
writeable by self/group. The readonly mode is not a problem updating the
file because of the way the neutron_lib replace_file function handles
the files operations.

Closes-Bug: #1777922

Change-Id: Ic5d976ba71a966a537d1f31888f82997a7ccb0de
Signed-off-by: aojeagarcia <aojeagarcia@suse.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9f2b40f2cecc116906e77d69797c0c6877bd5b4d)
(cherry picked from commit e6c63513de5f715437b03d8718b06f496a1e1646)
"}]
commit_message:
Dropping radvd process privileges

radvd needs to run as root, but has the capability to drop privileges on
linux hosts. Currently, radvd process is not using this feature and
this can be considered a serious risk.

In addition, some distributions like SUSE, radvd process runs as a non
privileged user by default, causing radvd failure to daemonize
because it can't write the pid in the corresponding neutron folder and
break the IPv6 functionality.

This patch allows radvd process to run with the same user used by
neutron. In order to allow this, it changes the radvd config file
permissions to 444 because radvd doesn't allow that this file can be
writeable by self/group. The readonly mode is not a problem updating the
file because of the way the neutron_lib replace_file function handles
the files operations.

Closes-Bug: #1777922

Change-Id: Ic5d976ba71a966a537d1f31888f82997a7ccb0de
Signed-off-by: aojeagarcia <aojeagarcia@suse.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9f2b40f2cecc116906e77d69797c0c6877bd5b4d)
(cherry picked from commit e6c63513de5f715437b03d8718b06f496a1e1646)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-11 20:42:47.000000000', 'message': 'Make neutron-tempest-iptable_hybrid job non-voting

Because of bug [1] neutron-tempest-iptables_hybrid job
is failing 100% times.
As we decided on Neutron CI meeting, lets make it non-voting
and remove it from gate queue temporary to unblock all

commit_message:
Make neutron-tempest-iptable_hybrid job non-voting

Because of bug [1] neutron-tempest-iptables_hybrid job
is failing 100% times.
As we decided on Neutron CI meeting, lets make it non-voting
and remove it from gate queue temporary to unblock all
other patches until this bug will be fixed.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/os-vif/+bug/1807949

Change-Id: Ic3a43629bb924e3ae48b919c6fd518674a530bbb
Related-Bug: 1807949

can use them independently of the replace function.

commit_message:
Remove the log container in the AIO config

The log container adds IO contention during the AIO deployment,
and slows down the deployment. It has very limited value for an
AIO given that all journals are on the same host anyway.

Change-Id: Ib05794b88770ba5c0d6f85265cc62e76037cbd67

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-29 18:12:37.000000000', 'message': "Check Volume Status on attahcment create/update

Currently the new Attachment calls in Cinder aren't checking the status
of the volume when create or update is called.  This isn't good because
it can mask problems with attach processes on the volume.

This patch adds an explicit check of the volume status in both
attachment_create and attachment_update, and if the volume status is in
any error state, the call will result in an InvalidVolume exception.

This is an API change to fix a bug, and is not microversioned.

Change-Id: I9b32c4db93879dda6490b244643de1a18bddbbf5
"}, {'created': '2018-11-29 20:18:16.000000000', 'message': "Check Volume Status on attahcment create/update

Currently the new Attachment calls in Cinder aren't checking the status
of the volume when create or update is called.  This isn't good because
it can mask problems with attach processes on the volume.

This patch adds an explicit check of the volume status in both
attachment_create and attachment_update, and if the volume status is in
any error state, the call will result in an InvalidVolume exception.

commit_message:
Check Volume Status on attahcment create/update

Currently the new Attachment calls in Cinder aren't checking the status
of the volume when create or update is called.  This isn't good because
it can mask problems with attach processes on the volume.

This patch adds an explicit check of the volume status in both
attachment_create and attachment_update, and if the volume status is in
any error state, the call will result in an InvalidVolume exception.

This is an API change to fix a bug, and is not microversioned.

Closes-Bug: #1805762

Change-Id: I9b32c4db93879dda6490b244643de1a18bddbbf5

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-13 13:35:02.000000000', 'message': 'docs: cleanup install docs

This does a few things to the home page and all-in-one single
machine install guide:

* Uses code blocks for formatting
* Adds the customary "$" to the console blocks in the
  all-in-one single machine install guide
* Instructs to use "sudo su stack" and adds a note about
  "sudo visudo" in the all-in-one single machine doc
* Creates a symbolic link to the sample local.conf and links to
  it from the install guide (note that local.conf might be old
  by now)
* Fixes the .gitignore file to only ignore local.conf in the root
  of the repository, otherwise it would ignore local.conf everywhere
  including the samples and doc/source/assets directories.

Change-Id: I50ae7bd32c4c1caa2ac8551fc54b31dd2dfae568
'}]
commit_message:
docs: cleanup install docs

This does a few things to the home page and all-in-one single
machine install guide:

* Uses code blocks for formatting
* Adds the customary "$" to the console blocks in the
  all-in-one single machine install guide
* Instructs to use "sudo su stack" and adds a note about
  "sudo visudo" in the all-in-one single machine doc
* Creates a symbolic link to the sample local.conf and links to
  it from the install guide (note that local.conf might be old
  by now)
* Fixes the .gitignore file to only ignore local.conf in the root
  of the repository, otherwise it would ignore local.conf everywhere
  including the samples and doc/source/assets directories.

Change-Id: I50ae7bd32c4c1caa2ac8551fc54b31dd2dfae568

commit_message:
Remove sqlalchemy osprofiler

sqlalchemy osprofiler is set up for Neutron by neutron-lib in [1]. As a
consequence, there is no need to set it up in Neutron. Besides, when
profiling Neutron code, this duplication creates repetitive output in
the reports. This patch removes this set up from the DB API module.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lib/blob/master/neutron_lib/db/api.py

Change-Id: I15f3ee374333e3cba2bf659439dd82263681f1df

commit_message:
builtins for z3 theories

Adds basic comparison, arithmetic and bit arithmetic to Z3 theories.
Builtins depend on the kind of theory in use. Z3 builtins are the only
polymorphic predicates of the engine.

Change-Id: Icb68c71ec29604638282a34d34ce06f1e1d69275
Implements: blueprint alternative-engine-z3

commit_message:
Update keystoneauth1 3.4.0 to 3.11.0 in lower-constraints.txt

The 'python-novaclient' requires keystoneauth1 >=3.5.0
The 'python-glanceclient' requires keystoneauth1 >=3.6.2
The 'osc-lib'  requires keystoneauth1 >=3.7.0
The 'openstacksdk' requires  keystoneauth1 >=3.11.0

Change-Id: I3593008d3bf66a9a2ee36abb104fb3436c82019b

subject: Use --profile feature for generating tempest.conf
messages:
[{'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-12-07 07:45:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-12-07 10:37:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2018-12-07 19:52:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-12-10 06:32:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-12-12 08:31:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Last conversation we had on this topic said to explicitly not have a template because of the fear of extensibility, and the proliferation of hacks.

If everyone is okay with that, I am fine with it. Please merge all the appropriate patches into one though.'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-12-17 06:04:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Last conversation we had on this topic said to explicitly not have
 > a template because of the fear of extensibility, and the
 > proliferation of hacks.
 > 
 > If everyone is okay with that, I am fine with it. Please merge all
 > the appropriate patches into one though.

In order to handle all the named args related to tempestconf, we added a new a feature called profile [https://review.openstack.org/#/c/621567/ ], where we can dump all the named args there and reuse for generating tempest.conf automatically. It will help to keep only one var for tempestconf arguments and easily pass the value below that. I am merging this patch in a single patch.'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-12-17 06:06:48.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/623187/'}]

commit_message:
Use --profile feature for generating tempest.conf

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/621567/ adds -profile argument
through which we can dump all the cli args to a yaml file and
pass the yaml file using --profile to tempestconf and it will
generate the tempest.conf for the same.

It also removes tempest_tempestconf_extra_cli_overrides as it
is taken care by profile.

Change-Id: Iafaa3b336ece73b68909a54bc3442dd604bac586

As described in the bug report, this is the intended behavior in horizon. If horizon cannot confirm if a feature is available, a corresponding panel is not shown. This is needed to support various releases of back-end services in horizon.'}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2018-12-17 05:51:46.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoning this for now, will be restored after discussion on the same.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-11 10:55:51.000000000', 'message': "Fix: Volume groups panel missing when cinder service is down

When cinder services are down , Groups & Group Snapshot
panels disappeared from the dashboard.It should be consistent with
Volumes / snapshots panel,Groups and Group Snapshot panel also
should appear in horizon and throw an exception like
'Unable to retrieve volume groups'.
This patch fixes the issue.

Change-Id: Ia984f13f177d6130a22314b75c6e385bcea82794

commit_message:
Fix: Volume groups panel missing when cinder service is down

When cinder services are down , Groups & Group Snapshot
panels disappeared from the dashboard.It should be consistent with
Volumes / snapshots panel,Groups and Group Snapshot panel also
should appear in horizon and throw an exception like
'Unable to retrieve volume groups'.
This patch fixes the issue.

Change-Id: Ia984f13f177d6130a22314b75c6e385bcea82794
Closes-Bug: #1807874

commit_message:
Cleanup running jobs

With the changed PTI doc building, this repo can now use the standard
way of building docs, use publish-openstack-docs-pti template and remove
custom jobs.

Since this repo is not co-installed, it does not need requirements and
lower-constraints - like none of the documentation projects. Remove
these.

Remove also lower-constraints tox environment and unused pip install
command from tox.ini as the default is just fine.

Remove passenv from docs environment, this is not needed with current CI
jobs anymore.

Change-Id: I52544b825d3de626f25a81acdb0f62e73771051a

commit_message:
Enable direct-io on LVM loop devices

This enables direct-io on the loop devices that we create for LVM backing
stores. The goal here is to reduce the buffer cache overhead involved with
loop mounting a very large file on a filesystem, as well as potentially
providing a little more block-device-like behavior for things that expect
them. We are hoping this will address some of the very long LVM calls that
cinder does, which randomly take a very long time, causing timeouts.

The loop direct-io support was added in kernel 4.4.0, which was xenial,
but the losetup binary does not have the required flag. Thus, this patch
checks the "losetup -h" output for the flag before deciding to enable it.

Change-Id: Idc69cf3598d6ed6646c0145733c90ad0b1b60883

commit_message:
Switch the default NIC driver to e1000

The version if qemu-ipxe on bionic doesn't attempt
to network boot when using virtio-net.

Change-Id: I335a2a0a8a82bb43a06202f96e629aa72d10cfac
Story: #2004604
Task: #28498

(1 comment)

Greetings!  This seems interesting, but I'm not sure I understand the use case. Could you please create a "request for enhancement" item in storyboard.openstack.org so we can track and review this item.

Also, you'll want to propose unit tests.

Also, it may be better to only construct what we perceive as a view of the hash ring only when queried for the host to match. It wouldn't be something added to the node object (well, there is a field, but it is hidden in the data model (conductor_affinity)).'}, {'account_id': 28354, 'date': '2018-12-17 01:57:36.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add audit scoper for baremetal data model

Bare metal cluster data model was introduced in Queens cycle.
Since the model is different from compute data model, we
need add CDM scoper for bare metal cluster data model

Change-Id: Idd041cefb692085d4545252d229ebe8602926b58
Implements: blueprint audit-scoper-for-baremetal-data-model

(4 comments)

I'm not sure what this would help us to understand because the api-ref result in the gate has gone in the three months. However, I don't like the inconsistency within the fix like one is still only status code (e.g. 200), another is capital but another is lower case (e.g. unauthorized), further, one is not same code with http status (e.g. requested Range not satisfiable) so -1 to fix the inconsistency."}, {'account_id': 23317, 'date': '2018-12-17 00:41:19.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Switch standalone & undercloud to Podman by default

Unless an operator overrides it, the default undercloud & standalone
deployment will be on Podman and not on Docker anymore.

blueprint podman-support
Change-Id: Ided7b88fa984ca49f487fd0573e0c5e78c5480e8

commit_message:
Add yaml* to collect-logs

We are doing a ansible copy with backup options
containers-prepare-parameters.yaml here [1], it adds a suffix for the
backup let's save the backup too

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/621517/

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/621517/

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-12 17:38:32.000000000', 'message': "Ensure that systemd-resolved is present in the Centos container

For ubuntu systems this should already be installed via the 'systemd'
package, and there does not appear to be a specific package for
systemd-resolved on opensuse systems.

Change-Id: Idae9f51e2ce961ed20ee66691f044f1958ed9009
(cherry picked from commit 4efa9c991c09164f4bbdfb0069760a6fba1d4994)
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure that systemd-resolved is present in the Centos container

For ubuntu systems this should already be installed via the 'systemd'
package, and there does not appear to be a specific package for
systemd-resolved on opensuse systems.

Change-Id: Idae9f51e2ce961ed20ee66691f044f1958ed9009
(cherry picked from commit 4efa9c991c09164f4bbdfb0069760a6fba1d4994)

commit_message:
Return execution state_info in ExternalResource

When a workflow execution fails, we don't return anything information to
the user. Let's propage what mistral sends us in the resource failure.

Change-Id: Ib412346f12450fa5e6a1291d635debe1a4add380
Story: #2004396
Task: #28025
(cherry picked from commit 03154ba7111e5f9bb484d1a0b49a90ee7f6b8006)

commit_message:
Remove tripleo newton and ocata jobs (queens branch)

Non-containerized multinode scenario jobs are no longer supported
and should be removed from zuul config.

Change-Id: I0c98aecd82478fbf7e2b2a45d5b2664290155ed9

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10086, 'date': '2017-04-26 02:29:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(3 comments)

Thanks for the feedback.

There's a suggestion to use supervisord to background the process itself, and have the action control the setup/start/stop of the osd reweighting process as a service.  Any objections you see to adding the supervisor package to ceph-mon nodes in order to allow this?"}, {'account_id': 10086, 'date': '2017-04-26 08:43:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 10086, 'date': '2017-04-26 08:49:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

This patchset adds a timeout for overall plus each step, and some slightly more granular status checking, plus renaming things a bit to make the code a bit clearer.

What I've not done here is add the ability to fork to the background as a separate service, which is really adding a new service to overcome the limitations of another.  I'd rather, if possible, see us improve Juju to handle this kind of action better.

Regardless of the above, the intention of this initial change is to get the ball rolling - we can improve the action as we see the need, once the first steps are agreed."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-04-26 08:50:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified+1

commit_message:
Add action reweight_osd_slowly

Adds an action to gradually change the weight of an OSD to a final
target.

Change-Id: I12924c319d4b7cd787c87aa87a913982e0b71c90
Partial-Bug: #1675387

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-13 23:50:17.000000000', 'message': 'Check if agent can reach neutron server

The ovs agent will install some basic drop flows first for the
physical bridge mappings during the init procedure. If message
queue is not connected, or neutron-servers are all down, real
traffic flows will not be refreshed anymore. This will cause
the data plane down if tenant network and provider network are
sharing the physical NICs.

This patch adds a RPC check during init L2 agent. When restart
the ovs-agent, if the MQ is OK and we have available neutron-server,
go next step. Otherwise, a rpc timeout will be raised. L2 agent
will start fail, physical bridge mapping drop flows will not be
installed. The original flows will not be replaced, so the traffic
can still work properly.

Closes-Bug: #1803919
Change-Id: Ie15cf625b3710eaf290d6aafecb3f65df664b9df
(cherry picked from commit 0385868848f8c18c8a37fd4c661d1b1a5078e044)
'}]
commit_message:
Check if agent can reach neutron server

The ovs agent will install some basic drop flows first for the
physical bridge mappings during the init procedure. If message
queue is not connected, or neutron-servers are all down, real
traffic flows will not be refreshed anymore. This will cause
the data plane down if tenant network and provider network are
sharing the physical NICs.

This patch adds a RPC check during init L2 agent. When restart
the ovs-agent, if the MQ is OK and we have available neutron-server,
go next step. Otherwise, a rpc timeout will be raised. L2 agent
will start fail, physical bridge mapping drop flows will not be
installed. The original flows will not be replaced, so the traffic
can still work properly.

Closes-Bug: #1803919
Change-Id: Ie15cf625b3710eaf290d6aafecb3f65df664b9df
(cherry picked from commit 0385868848f8c18c8a37fd4c661d1b1a5078e044)

Stop cleaning images to be deleted in remotefs driver

snapshot deletion in remotefs driver.

Closes-Bug: #1805853

as a hammer to set the logging in places we otherwise weren't
properly.

A later version of this will do this more appropriately.

Change-Id: I70c3028423eddb4721456f645c4475da4af7ced5
"}, {'created': '2018-12-14 19:08:22.000000000', 'message': '[Calico] Logging fixes/updates

Expose the early logging level for calico-node.

Use conf.node.FELIX_LOGSEVERITYSCREEN to set logging level in
BGPConfiguration and FelixConfiguration (whilst this is an odd
name/location it backwards compatible and will in most cases set
things as expected).

Change-Id: I70c3028423eddb4721456f645c4475da4af7ced5
'}, {'created': '2018-12-16 07:22:04.000000000', 'message': '[Calico] Logging fixes/updates

commit_message:
[Calico] Logging fixes/updates

Expose the early logging level for calico-node.

Use conf.node.FELIX_LOGSEVERITYSCREEN to set logging level in
BGPConfiguration and FelixConfiguration (whilst this is an odd
name/location it backwards compatible and will in most cases set
things as expected).

Change-Id: I70c3028423eddb4721456f645c4475da4af7ced5

commit_message:
Neutron: Perform full db migrations when TaaS enabled

This PS fixes the neutron db sync job to perform full db migrations
in addaion to tap-as-a-service when enabled.

Change-Id: Ieab54649344fb8737e2d8855f00a9ed574ace5ee
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Fix DeploymentStatusAction KeyError

This change fixes KeyError which occurred In case when
config_download_deploy workflow execution is not finished
and the output is empty.

Change-Id: I5cc5731b5dafd753d6bcd5242052e1f08ce0d974

commit_message:
Immutable user source: test_default_project_id

If the keystone user source is immutable, such as an LDAP
active directory implementation, tempest tests that try
to create or delete a user will fail. Instead of failing,
we would like them to skip. This change uses a testtools
decorator to avoid unnecessary modifications and allow those tests
to skip. In [1], I introduced the config setting that allows
this to happen.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/585536/

Change-Id: I4d928fdbf04de65a73977dbe4a818dff4cb2aa8d
Partial-Bug: 1777047

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ifeef1cfb4b764c7a2d0351eb1c3f3660262350c8
Closes-Bug:  #1801657

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I721815ac34e3cd0bc84a5e69104aecfe7fd62e79

commit_message:
Fix EXTRA_VARS calculation for env_vars_to_source_file.

Currently, even if dlrn_hash_tag_newest is found, it's not rendered in
the env_vars_to_src.sh file.

This fix it, and make the EXTRA_VARS line more readable.

Change-Id: I604c7780ab7e37204360b74791b8522ff31ea695

commit_message:
Add tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario004-standalone job

As tracked in [1] this adds a standalone scenario4 job. It uses
the standalone_environment_files featureset-override with fs52
and the scenario004 environment added in tripleo-heat-templates.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/621517 # oooq-extras
[1] https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/339
Change-Id: I03eb6e4805b3c8c21de93377a94a07617a119145

We can see the ldap bootstrap job failing, which seems to be due to the init container for the job not being able to talk to the endpoint for determining whether the dependencies have been resolved: http://logs.openstack.org/06/612506/28/check/openstack-helm-infra-aio-network-policy/dd4f43e/primary/pod-logs/osh-infra/ldap-bootstrap-q2clf/init.txt

As part of this, we should really include NetworkPolicy objects as part of the post run jobs to help us determine proper root causes here'}, {'account_id': 17591, 'date': '2018-12-12 17:50:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 28:

> We can see the ldap bootstrap job failing, which seems to be due to

 > 
 > As part of this, we should really include NetworkPolicy objects as
 > part of the post run jobs to help us determine proper root causes
 > here

Scratch my comment - I see the networkpolicy objects are already included.  We need to determine the cause of the failures wrt the init containers however.  At a glance, it seems there's issues communicating with the kubernetes api"}, {'account_id': 28592, 'date': '2018-12-12 18:11:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 29.'}, {'account_id': 28592, 'date': '2018-12-12 19:14:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 30.'}, {'account_id': 28592, 'date': '2018-12-12 20:24:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 31.'}, {'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2018-12-12 21:42:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28592, 'date': '2018-12-13 14:58:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 32.'}, {'account_id': 28592, 'date': '2018-12-13 15:38:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 33.'}, {'account_id': 22636, 'date': '2018-12-13 22:37:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 33: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Add Egress Helm-toolkit function & enforce the nework policy at OSH-INFRA

This PS implements the helm toolkit function to generate the
Egress in kubernetes network policy manifest based on overrideable values.
It also enbale the K8s network policy at Osh-infra gate.

Change-Id: Icbe2a18c98dba795d15398dcdcac64228f6a7b4c

subject: Handle the case that 'numactl' not installed
messages: [{'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-12-15 17:14:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-12-15 23:05:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nThis fixes a critical bug so fast approved.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-15 17:14:49.000000000', 'message': "Handle the case that 'numactl' not installed

If the program 'numactl' is not installed, the Zun compute process
fails and the compute node is not up. This commit makes Zun to
be robust in this case.

Change-Id: I0969d52896cc89fe443f312debe2b4f477069952
Closes-Bug: #1808643
"}]
commit_message:
Handle the case that 'numactl' not installed

If the program 'numactl' is not installed, the Zun compute process
fails and the compute node is not up. This commit makes Zun to
be robust in this case.

Change-Id: I0969d52896cc89fe443f312debe2b4f477069952
Closes-Bug: #1808643

commit_message:
functional: use default admission_control_list values

The functional jobs are currently deploying with an empty list of
admission control list which means that the service token controller
does not go up resulting in the cluster failing to go up.

This patch drops that so it uses the default values of the admission
controllers in order to get the cluster to go up cleanly.

Change-Id: I0fdd65a9859f34e202016c37620f553623ef8a3e
(cherry picked from commit 3646a59eac0b3bdacce664ad24fbfb16cbdcc133)

commit_message:
functional: add body for delete_namespaced_service in k8s

The API for delete_namespaced_service requires a body which when
missing will fail the functional tests.

This patch addresses that issue by adding an empty body in order
for the delete to work properly.

Change-Id: I3b4a4bb08f60d9d18368dd3faa84ab1348acb543
Story: #2002589
Task: #28341
(cherry picked from commit e0fd3f9ef1a8666e082f9050b6e116cae4d7ad33)

commit_message:
functional: use vexxhost-specific nodes with nested virt

This patch changes the intergration jobs to use nodes which are
at VEXXHOST that come with supported nested virtualization in
order to allow for the functional jobs to finish on-time.

Change-Id: Ie275caac1a40fb3f10a0653b66611d2ba9d1c470
Story: #2002589
Task: #28341
(cherry picked from commit 2e2ebaf679c7480f6809ad52f97f5c7cf6684ead)

commit_message:
Changes in container builder

* do not log the login command
* change dockerhub creds
* fix reference of tag in the push images task
* add retries
* remove repository parameter
* pull fedora from docker.io
* name docker_image tasks for each kubernetes and magnum images
* drop async logs

Change-Id: Iead202bdf9d7d42d0b7e21bea73a298678be714b
Signed-off-by: Spyros Trigazis <spyridon.trigazis@cern.ch>

commit_message:
Move Octavia config opts to common config directory

Octavia fails to failover an amphora with its load balancer in
active-standby topology.

This issue is caused by a misconfiguration of Octavia by tripleo-common
where setting amp_boot_network_list and amp_secgroup_list are being
loaded only by the worker service. These two options are shared by the
worker and health manager services.

This backport patch also includes a fix that went in commit
b6e82e20b0345d4b3d01a2dd25c87ac33922a222 that addressed a syntax error.

Closes-Bug: #1788571
Change-Id: Ibc73ece9bbd5dc0664fdc950ea48929a4b36b4a9
(cherry picked from commit b00b866564abfd824fdebc8a33348a0df00a5944)
(cherry picked from commit f863f02b1014c0cf568578bae3ade2e0da817238)

commit_message:
ceilometer: --skip-metering-database is gone

Option --skip-metering-database is gone since OSP13
(I6b262dd440a72f25662b64d938ab9e5328709a97).

This change removes it.

Closes-bug: #1743563

Change-Id: I675dc4985cdb3a86fac0a8421518ff3d7c784214
(cherry picked from commit 60f6300e9bbd255a8a8f65d7ed5b50cbb5e4e662)

Isn't this out of order? I thought we weren't going to remove this option until we have something to replace it, which is the new option from the spec."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-11-21 14:33:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Maybe you're just following the series of proposed changes from the spec:

https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/stein/approved/live-migration-force-after-timeout.html#proposed-change

But I think that is kind of backward - we would add the new live_migration_timeout_action option and use that when a live migration completion times out, and then we can safely drop the old deprecated config option.

I see the work items are also kind of backward:

https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/stein/approved/live-migration-force-after-timeout.html#work-items

But from an upgrades / CI/CD perspective, we want to replace the broken deprecated functionality first and then drop the deprecated option."}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-11-21 16:06:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Isn't this out of order? I thought we weren't going to remove this
 > option until we have something to replace it, which is the new
 > option from the spec.

OK, thanks, I will change its order in next PS. : )"}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-11-22 03:36:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-11-22 04:20:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
libvirt: remove live_migration_progress_timeout config

Config option ``libvirt.live_migration_progress_timeout`` was
deprecated in Ocata, and can now be removed.

This patch remove live_migration_progress_timeout and also remove
the migration progress timeout related logic.

Change-Id: Ife89a705892ad96de6d5f8e68b6e4b99063a7512
blueprint: live-migration-force-after-timeout

subject: libvirt: add live migration timeout action

[{'created': '2018-11-21 03:54:50.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Add live migration timeout action

This patch remove the auto trigger post-copy, and add a new libvirt
configuration 'live_migration_completion_action'.

This option determines what actions will be taken against a VM after
``live_migration_completion_timeout`` expires. This option is set to
'abort' action by default, that means the live migrate operation will
be aborted after completion timeout expires. If opetion is set to
'force_complete', that means will either pause the VM or trigger
post_copy depending on if post copy is enabled and available.

Change-Id: I0d286d12e588b431df3d94cf2e65d636bcdea2f8
blueprint: live-migration-force-after-timeout

commit_message:
libvirt: add live migration timeout action

This patch remove the auto trigger post-copy, and add a new libvirt
configuration 'live_migration_completion_action'.

This option determines what actions will be taken against a VM after
``live_migration_completion_timeout`` expires. This option is set to
'abort' action by default, that means the live migrate operation will
be aborted after completion timeout expires. If option is set to
'force_complete', that means will either pause the VM or trigger
post_copy depending on if post copy is enabled and available.

Note that the progress based post-copy triggering from the libvirt
driver will be removed in next patch [1].

[1] Ife89a705892ad96de6d5f8e68b6e4b99063a7512

Change-Id: I0d286d12e588b431df3d94cf2e65d636bcdea2f8
blueprint: live-migration-force-after-timeout

commit_message:
Correct file modes for rpmlint failures

Numerous files have incorrect modes set. Correct these so that executables
have 755 and yaml files are 644 to address rpmlint errors.

Change-Id: I8db36209b41a492f6b85e3469994de884bf556e8

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-14 20:35:08.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: test for force complete live migrate with post-copy

This is a simple test to try and trigger the force_complete
live migration timeout post-copy action. Since our CI system
uses tiny Cirros guests we have to throttle the live migration
bandwidth to 1MiB and try and hit the timeout (1 second) and then
trigger post-copy (which should be available since we run with
libvirt 4.0.0 in the gate).

Change-Id: I328e5a5828a62bfa681298fd424eedfa6c2045ed
'}]
commit_message:
DNM: test for force complete live migrate with post-copy

This is a simple test to try and trigger the force_complete
live migration timeout post-copy action. Since our CI system
uses tiny Cirros guests we have to throttle the live migration
bandwidth to 1MiB and try and hit the timeout (1 second) and then
trigger post-copy (which should be available since we run with
libvirt 4.0.0 in the gate).

Change-Id: I328e5a5828a62bfa681298fd424eedfa6c2045ed

commit_message:
Revert "Remove slow tests from blacklist"

This reverts commit 7728027cdd575f7d43c97b4b7a9345c69898c26f.

test_encrypted_cinder_volumes_cryptsetup fails with the rbd
cinder volume type and for whatever reason it was not caught
(was not run) by the devstack-plugin-ceph-tempest job on
this repo, which might be a bug in the zuul job config.

Change-Id: I7831df5ce8925887e3673328608924f1b83944e0

[{'created': '2018-12-14 15:07:28.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Test attach encrypted volume"

This reverts commit c6d3b842685c06fed0bfeeef30b18332c5abdd07.

The change to tempest_test_blacklist in the job zuul job
definition means that the blacklist is only applied when the
job runs on changes to devstack-plugin-ceph but not when
the job runs on changes in any other repo, like cinder or
nova, which means the job is 100% failure now outside of this
repo since the rbd backend doesn't support plain encrypted
volume types.

commit_message:
Revert "Test attach encrypted volume"

This reverts commit c6d3b842685c06fed0bfeeef30b18332c5abdd07.

The change to tempest_test_blacklist in the job zuul job
definition means that the blacklist is only applied when the
job runs on changes to devstack-plugin-ceph but not when
the job runs on changes in any other repo, like cinder or
nova, which means the job is 100% failure now outside of this
repo since the rbd backend doesn't support plain encrypted
volume types.

Change-Id: I09bac6f417aec5c8d74f4036f7cd19091f99c73b

commit_message:
Add advanced configuration of container images

Indoduces yaml editor as a second step of container images configuration
wizard. This lets user review generated configuration and tweak details.

Story: 2004509
Task: 28235
Change-Id: Icbd074112ac8caa5faca378aca4fd07b3992185f
(cherry picked from commit 278188902da5a7aa42727ead85aedcdc19f12e55)

demonstrates both OVS bonds and Linux bonds. Networks that are
marked with "ovs_bridge: true" in the network_data.yaml file
will be placed on the OVS bridge/bond, and other networks

commit_message:
Add a dual-bond example NIC config template

This change adds a 2-bonds-with-vlans example template which
demonstrates the use of two Linux bonds. This template will
place the 'Tenant*' networks on a bond with an OVS bridge.
Other networks will be placed as VLANs on the Linux bond
without a bridge. There is special handling for the Tenant
network on DPDK-enabled Compute nodes.

Change-Id: I9277c0e6a1267392943214eb5fe55509f7956fbc

commit_message:
Adopt use of pre-commit linting

Follows the same configuration that was used on
tripleo-quickstart-extras and documented use on tripleo-docs.

Change-Id: Iba8a2db92137f9f6ad28f498627eb1b87039d99f
Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/381

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary 'set -x' at EOL in genconfig script

tools/generate_config_file_samples.sh contains 'set -x'
at the end of line but it is unnecessary.

It was pointed out in the policy-in-code review
and I borrowed a script from this.

Change-Id: I2a0fd6051702693db340904fbe738d44ca4f15c0

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-14 11:26:02.000000000', 'message': "Add patch to fix horizon tests

Without this patch, we see issues in the unit tests when building

commit_message:
Add patch to fix horizon tests

Without this patch, we see issues in the unit tests when building
horizon extensions:

  AttributeError: 'AnonymousUser' object has no attribute 'token'

Adding this patch to horizon should correct the issue for the other
dashboards.

Change-Id: I1c1fc2e34038bb6cbd5752e609e500b91d305ea1

Deletion of healthcheck unit files was inadvertenly lost in a rebase in

for removing systemd service and timer files for healthchecks.

Change-Id: I0c91c5364f82d09c10a40ef3a59da2c6c7110101

commit_message:
Make systemd.service_delete handle healthchecks

Deletion of healthcheck unit files was inadvertenly lost in a rebase in
I1949b7ba9e06110a2e91c9cb3359605cae3638e5. This change adds that support
for removing systemd service and timer files for healthchecks.

Change-Id: I0c91c5364f82d09c10a40ef3a59da2c6c7110101

commit_message:
fs001/035/053: switch undercloud to podman

To iterate in podman testing, switch the main ovb jobs to deploy an undercloud
with podman instead of docker, in master (stein) only.

blueprint podman-support

Change-Id: I1390dc4496ce4bedf155cbe97be2a51b8f5b47eb

subject: Address python3 string issues with subprocess
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 11090, 'name': 'Sergii Golovatiuk', 'email': 'sgolovat@redhat.com', 'username': 'holser'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27427, 'name': 'David Peacock', 'email': 'dpeacock@redhat.com', 'username': 'davidjpeacock'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-12 20:38:40.000000000', 'message': 'Address python3 string issues with subprocess

This patch updates our Popen calls to enable universal newlines for
calls that we parse or consume the output for. Without
univeral_newlines=True, the output is treated as bytes under python3
which leads to issues later where we are using it as strings.

See https://docs.python.org/3/glossary.html#term-universal-newlines

Change-Id: I1a9edd0ebac6f0539ac5c33056c442cfcfafb7f3
Related-Blueprint: python3-support
'}]
commit_message:
Address python3 string issues with subprocess

This patch updates our Popen calls to enable universal newlines for
calls that we parse or consume the output for. Without
univeral_newlines=True, the output is treated as bytes under python3
which leads to issues later where we are using it as strings.

See https://docs.python.org/3/glossary.html#term-universal-newlines

Change-Id: I1a9edd0ebac6f0539ac5c33056c442cfcfafb7f3
Related-Blueprint: python3-support

commit_message:
Drop baremetal job template

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/619337/ switched the jobs to a noop so
it no longer makes sense to define them here. If we need to run the
specific jobs then we'll need to define those in this project explictly.

Change-Id: Ib8bd3b4fbee9070619c54dd7b77f0f76059e6df3

commit_message:
Update cirros version

This is the next release in the 0.3.x stable series, containing a fix
for getting out of disk errors when cirros reads metadata from a
config-drive[0].

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/cirros/+bug/1808119

Change-Id: Id2f20ebafdd78c2dadf81b8f80f22e7bd6db7755

commit_message:
Add Fix django.contrib.auth.middleware monkey patching for APITestCase

This patch rollbacks changes in APITestCase introduced in the
0d163613265e036818fe567793a4fc88fe140d4a commit to unblock Horizon
plugins gates.

(cherry picked from commit de69edd0402146d76c65cec6cc7879c71259fbbf)

commit_message:
Implemented livenessProbe for different OpenStack api containers

LivenessProbe is added to the below deployments:
  glance-api
  glance-registry
  heat-api
  heat-cfn
  horizon
  keystone-api
  nova-api-metadata
  nova-api-osapi
  nova-placement-api

Change-Id: I76b8cafa437855eeb42b77e88da6e3c514a3ac90
Signed-off-by: Huang,Sophie(sh879n) <sh879n@att.com>

commit_message:
systemd/healthcheck: fix service names for requires/requisite

The services are prefixed by tripleo_ by default, it was missed during a
rebase.
It also adds a assertIn test for the service healthcheck, to verify that
Requisite is properly set.

Change-Id: Ia07edb9597c098a1e5df0e20982c91005b245b9c

When a subnet's enable_dhcp attribute is updated, we must restart
dhcp device. So,when we decide whether 'restart' or
'reload_allocations' in refresh_dhcp_helper function we only compare
the cidr of subnets which enabled dhcp.

The previous logic only calls 'restart' when deleting or adding a
subnet. This may cause the dhcp port not updated when the subnet's

commit_message:
Fix the bug about DHCP port whose network has multiple subnets.

When a subnet's enable_dhcp attribute is updated, we must restart
dhcp device. So,when we decide whether 'restart' or
'reload_allocations' in refresh_dhcp_helper function we only compare
the cidr of subnets which enabled dhcp.

The previous logic only calls 'restart' when deleting or adding a
subnet. This may cause the dhcp port not updated when the subnet's
enable_dhcp is updated to True.

Change-Id: Ic547946ac786c5fab82b4ee7078bf86483f51eb5
Closes-Bug: #1805824

commit_message:
Switch the undercloud to deploy Podman by default starting from Stein

Starting from Stein, we want the Undercloud to be deploying Podman
containers instead of Docker containers.
This patch switches container_cli to be 'podman', and make sure we only
configure this new parameter in Stein and beyond.
Also run the container CLI with sudo, it's required to Podman on CentOS7.

blueprint podman-support
Change-Id: I21662de8ac0101a25c2b73a4650bb4af0f5df89a

commit_message:
Run local registry and prep cont at standalone

The standalone job were not running yum update on the containers, to do
so we need to specify the updater paremters in the
container-prepare-parameters [1] and also we have to activate the docker
local registry and call the conatiner prepare service.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/621517/

NOTE: this change differs from master as we do not have a podman service
in Rocky.
Related-Bug: #1808591

Change-Id: I74e817bc9b9dd522db3da7753c91a3884d99f8c8
Related-Bug: #1805968
(cherry picked from commit 62b54268af4c341288e745c356f28124f61e9d2b)

subject: Use a tempfile for the modified Dockerfile
messages:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-11-21 16:32:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-11-22 11:32:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-11-22 11:33:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

a bug to track Rocky backports?..'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-12-14 23:02:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-13 04:27:15.000000000', 'message': 'Use a tempfile for the modified Dockerfile

When using modify_image.yml directly with a multiple image prepare,
the Dockerfile.modified can be overwritten multiple times in a race
which causes the wrong images to be built.

This change uses a tempfile for the modified Dockerfile, avoiding this
issue.

yum_update.yml and rpm_install.yml is not affected by this because
they write out the Dockerfile to a temp directory for each image.

Change-Id: I374f76650ef0b0211d92435d66fdead2b7730b21
'}]
commit_message:
Use a tempfile for the modified Dockerfile

When using modify_image.yml directly with a multiple image prepare,
the Dockerfile.modified can be overwritten multiple times in a race
which causes the wrong images to be built.

This change uses a tempfile for the modified Dockerfile, avoiding this
issue.

yum_update.yml and rpm_install.yml is not affected by this because
they write out the Dockerfile to a temp directory for each image.

Change-Id: I374f76650ef0b0211d92435d66fdead2b7730b21

commit_message:
Drop baremetal job template

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/619337/ switched the jobs to a noop for
master and since this file is branched we no longer need to keep this
template definition in this project.

Change-Id: Ia54bd55d173a4cdf2368c2de99f70169b294bf63

Previously, we'd install development versions of Swift as root, causing

Change-Id: Ia688790f8b23ed1cf76947b5809c208df5dee8bb

commit_message:
Fix rolling upgrade job

Previously, we'd install development versions of Swift as root, causing
later tox runs as zuul to fail on a permissions error because the
generated egg-info (at least) was locked down.

Change-Id: Ia688790f8b23ed1cf76947b5809c208df5dee8bb

subject: Add support for cinder NFS snapshots
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-06 17:44:51.000000000', 'message': "Add support for cinder NFS snapshots

Add CinderNfsSnapshotSupport parameter that controls whether cinder's
NFS driver supports snapshots. The default value is True.

Depends-On: I4df8e3941eb074339e399e5a5c44fa411ff21560
Change-Id: I9a42f805fd28fd04bee771cac63bd0080b39c7c0

commit_message:
Add support for cinder NFS snapshots

Add CinderNfsSnapshotSupport parameter that controls whether cinder's
NFS driver supports snapshots. The default value is True.

Depends-On: I4df8e3941eb074339e399e5a5c44fa411ff21560
Change-Id: I9a42f805fd28fd04bee771cac63bd0080b39c7c0

commit_message:
Enable support for openidc federation in keystone

This exposes parameters to configure OpenIDC federation in Keystone.

Change-Id: I3e06ca5fde65f3e2c3c084f96209d1b38d5f8b86
Depends-on: Id2ef3558a359883bf3182f50d6a082b1789a900a

subject: Remove final users of utils.execute() in libvirt.

commit_message:
Remove final users of utils.execute() in libvirt.

Let us never speak of these things again.

Change-Id: I9bcc66b0dc203e08222276bced77d4409c3adcea

subject: Imagebackend should call processutils.execute directly.

commit_message:
Use self.create_port instead of client.create_port

Using self.create_port is better because it takes care of the
cleanup of resources.

Change-Id: Ia19ca6492137440cf387daa015ef5df6bffb6c9c

[{'created': '2018-12-13 15:12:40.000000000', 'message': 'Fix service naming conventions

We want to include the way the service is deployed (container/baremetal)
and the configuration management tool used (ansible/puppet) in the
service file name so folks can easily identify how a service is being
deployed and with what tooling.

Change-Id: Id884009131ea1587042a8ac01eec7afd83d7eb6a
Related-Blueprint: services-yaml-flattening
'}]
commit_message:
Fix service naming conventions

We want to include the way the service is deployed (container/baremetal)
and the configuration management tool used (ansible/puppet) in the
service file name so folks can easily identify how a service is being
deployed and with what tooling.

Change-Id: Id884009131ea1587042a8ac01eec7afd83d7eb6a
Related-Blueprint: services-yaml-flattening

commit_message:
Remove unused services in tripleo deploy

When rendering templates, check for services mapped to OS::Heat::None
and rewrite roles data to remove them. It reduces the numbers of
resources created, and improve in particular container image building.

Change-Id: I37aa673937681d5142feb74e89ca85fdb471db57

commit_message:
Add tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario001-standalone job

As tracked in [1] this adds a standalone scenario1 job. It uses
standalone_environment_files with featureset-override to specify
the scenario1 env file added in tripleo-heat-templates.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/621517 # oooq-extras
[1] https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/363
Change-Id: I885d0ab7377a66eedb4a8967b2c47549aea28dbe

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8175, 'date': '2018-12-14 12:16:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> (1 comment)

The only one merged so far is scen3. This commit suggests to add scen3 only... but in a few days we'll have scen1-4 in the template tripleo-standalone-scenarios-full. If the intent here is to add all scenarios, please change commit."}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-12-14 12:19:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > (1 comment)
 > 
 > The only one merged so far is scen3. This commit suggests to add
 > scen3 only... but in a few days we'll have scen1-4 in the template
 > tripleo-standalone-scenarios-full. If the intent here is to add all
 > scenarios, please change commit.

Should we then revert: https://review.openstack.org/623260 ? until you have all scenarios active as standalone? Then start disabling multinode jobs?"}, {'account_id': 8175, 'date': '2018-12-14 12:40:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > > (1 comment)
 > >
 > > The only one merged so far is scen3. This commit suggests to add
 > > scen3 only... but in a few days we'll have scen1-4 in the
 > template
 > > tripleo-standalone-scenarios-full. If the intent here is to add
 > all
 > > scenarios, please change commit.
 > 
 > Should we then revert: https://review.openstack.org/623260 ? until
 > you have all scenarios active as standalone? Then start disabling
 > multinode jobs?

No. That one disables multinode scen3 on master as the standalone scen3 is merged already. My suggestion here is: DO NOT add tripleo-standalone-scenarios-full as it will run scen1-4 standalone jobs, not only scen3. 

In other words, just replace multinode scen3 w/ standalone scen3."}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-12-14 12:45:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8175, 'date': '2018-12-14 12:50:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

thanks'}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2018-12-14 12:57:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-12-14 16:11:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Add tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario003-standalone job

This job is required to cover designate.

UPDATE:
  - Also ensure we run all jobs if zuul.d/* are changed.
  - Removed:
      tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario003-multinode-oooq-container

Change-Id: I31ae7f873617b69bfd8fee7010bab133e384795b
Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/us/338

commit_message:
[WIP]Fix freezer-api tempset ci failure

Currently, the zuul tests fail. The elasticsearch does not
response during 120s. In ubuntu-bionic using openjdk-8-jre
instead of default-jre may be able to solve this issue

Change-Id: Ie912945a8e94507c0e73f6889626c44f634df5b4

 > clause or be used in an aggregate function

that's the correct error message because these columns are all non-aggregates.  MySQL is notorious (and SQLite, for which the bar is just lower, but also wrong) for letting all of this slide, which is wrong.     MySQL has a SQL_MODE that corrects this which we should be turning on: https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/8.0/en/sql-mode.html#sqlmode_only_full_group_by

so...lose the group_by, then we look at the failures you are having once again.  One guess is that you have a test relying upon ordering somehow and removing the GROUP BY is affecting that.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-12-11 21:42:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-12-11 21:43:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-20 18:58:56.000000000', 'message': 'Apply DISTINCT clause to CellMapping.get_by_project_id for postgres

Without the DISTINCT clause on the query, postgresql fails
with:

  DBError: (psycopg2.ProgrammingError) column "instance_mappings.created_at"
  must appear in the GROUP BY clause or be used in an aggregate function

Since the functional tests for this use sqlite, there isn't really
a good way to test this outside of the postgresql-based integration
job, but the existing functional tests show it doesn't break the
existing GROUP BY in the query.

Change-Id: Idc9b5ad019205f447c82a702dd3391fa5dd20228
Closes-Bug: #1804271
'}, {'created': '2018-12-11 21:42:59.000000000', 'message': 'Remove GROUP BY clause from CellMapping.get_by_project_id

Under postgresql, the GROUP BY clause in this query fails with:

  DBError: (psycopg2.ProgrammingError) column "instance_mappings.created_at"
  must appear in the GROUP BY clause or be used in an aggregate function

And we're getting lucky with using this under mysql because we don't
have the ONLY_FULL_GROUP_BY mode set (but we probably should).

This change removes the GROUP BY clause and filters the results
in python.

Since the functional tests for this use sqlite, there isn't really
a good way to test this outside of the postgresql-based integration
job, but the existing functional tests show the object interface
still yields the same results.

Change-Id: Idc9b5ad019205f447c82a702dd3391fa5dd20228
Closes-Bug: #1804271
'}, {'created': '2018-12-13 20:09:16.000000000', 'message': 'Remove GROUP BY clause from CellMapping.get_by_project_id

Under postgresql, the GROUP BY clause in this query fails with:

  DBError: (psycopg2.ProgrammingError) column "instance_mappings.created_at"
  must appear in the GROUP BY clause or be used in an aggregate function

And we're getting lucky with using this under mysql because we don't
have the ONLY_FULL_GROUP_BY mode set (but we probably should).

This change removes the GROUP BY clause and re-writes the query
to avoid the joinedload() from the instance_mappings table and
simply do a subquery to get the cell_ids and then do a simple
IN query with the cell_mappings table. This fixes the GROUP BY
issue and should also make the query more efficient since we
won't have to load InstanceMappings ORM objects.

Change-Id: Idc9b5ad019205f447c82a702dd3391fa5dd20228
Closes-Bug: #1804271
'}]
commit_message:
Remove GROUP BY clause from CellMapping.get_by_project_id

Under postgresql, the GROUP BY clause in this query fails with:

  DBError: (psycopg2.ProgrammingError) column "instance_mappings.created_at"
  must appear in the GROUP BY clause or be used in an aggregate function

And we're getting lucky with using this under mysql because we don't
have the ONLY_FULL_GROUP_BY mode set (but we probably should).

This change removes the GROUP BY clause and re-writes the query
to avoid the joinedload() from the instance_mappings table and
simply do a subquery to get the cell_ids and then do a simple
IN query with the cell_mappings table. This fixes the GROUP BY
issue and should also make the query more efficient since we
won't have to load InstanceMappings ORM objects.

Change-Id: Idc9b5ad019205f447c82a702dd3391fa5dd20228
Closes-Bug: #1804271

Reference tempest_blacklist.txt file via zuul.projects

Finding this file via zuul.project only works if
the project is devstack-plugin-ceph, look for it via
zuul.projects which should work for any run of this
job.

[{'created': '2018-12-02 15:37:31.000000000', 'message': 'Fix dnsmasq option6 tagging logic

In attempting to fix option passing for Ironic, I discovered that
I would end up with option6:option6:59 if I passed "option6:59" or
I would end up with just "59".

According to the dnsmasq man page, "option6" labeling is mandatory.
That being said, I'll remove the transmission of "option6" from
ironic, but without fixing this issue IPv6 support for booting
baremetal nodes is broken.

Change-Id: I87c15908087111367358043f7a63dd02dd9d16ac
Story: 2004501
Task: 28219

commit_message:
Fix dnsmasq option6 tagging logic

In attempting to fix option passing for Ironic, I discovered that
I would end up with option6:option6:59 if I passed "option6:59" or
I would end up with just "59".

According to the dnsmasq man page, "option6" labeling is mandatory.
That being said, I'll remove the transmission of "option6" from
ironic, but without fixing this issue IPv6 support for booting
baremetal nodes is broken.

Change-Id: I87c15908087111367358043f7a63dd02dd9d16ac
Story: 2004501
Task: 28219

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

[{'created': '2018-12-14 22:32:17.000000000', 'message': 'Resolve ``ValueError`` when mapping value contains a literal ``=``.

Example ``setup.cfg``::

    project_urls =
      Documentation = https://format-pipfile.readthedocs.io/en/latest/?badge=latest

Current result::

    $ ./setup.py
    ERROR:root:Error parsing
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pbr/core.py", line 96, in pbr
        attrs = util.cfg_to_args(path, dist.script_args)
      File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pbr/util.py", line 258, in cfg_to_args
        kwargs = setup_cfg_to_setup_kwargs(config, script_args)
      File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pbr/util.py", line 336, in setup_cfg_to_setup_kwargs
        k, v = i.split(=)
    ValueError: too many values to unpack (expected 2)
    error in setup command: Error parsing /Users/brandon/src/format-pipfile/setup.cfg: ValueError: too many values to unpack (expected 2)

After changes::

    $ ./setup.py egg_info
    [...]
    $ grep -i project-url *.egg-info/PKG-INFO
    [...]
    Project-URL: Documentation, https://format-pipfile.readthedocs.io/en/latest/?badge=latest
    [...]

Change-Id: Iffbbedb846ef3bdde655ec6bbeb42356246cfebd
Signed-off-by: Brandon LeBlanc <brandon@leblanc.codes>
'}]
commit_message:
Resolve ``ValueError`` when mapping value contains a literal ``=``.

Example ``setup.cfg``::

    project_urls =
      Documentation = https://format-pipfile.readthedocs.io/en/latest/?badge=latest

Current result::

    $ ./setup.py
    ERROR:root:Error parsing
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pbr/core.py", line 96, in pbr
        attrs = util.cfg_to_args(path, dist.script_args)
      File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pbr/util.py", line 258, in cfg_to_args
        kwargs = setup_cfg_to_setup_kwargs(config, script_args)
      File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pbr/util.py", line 336, in setup_cfg_to_setup_kwargs
        k, v = i.split(=)
    ValueError: too many values to unpack (expected 2)
    error in setup command: Error parsing /Users/brandon/src/format-pipfile/setup.cfg: ValueError: too many values to unpack (expected 2)

After changes::

    $ ./setup.py egg_info
    [...]
    $ grep -i project-url *.egg-info/PKG-INFO
    [...]
    Project-URL: Documentation, https://format-pipfile.readthedocs.io/en/latest/?badge=latest
    [...]

Change-Id: Iffbbedb846ef3bdde655ec6bbeb42356246cfebd
Signed-off-by: Brandon LeBlanc <brandon@leblanc.codes>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-24 15:22:11.000000000', 'message': 'Execute functional test jobs running under python3

Functional tests are executed by trovestack script, which uses python
in default OS version which is 2.7.

This change wraps python in tox and executes trovestack int_tests in
virtual enviroment, starting them in python3.

Any future python version change could be managed by tox framework.

Change-Id: I3a849978241d3d0669ef9e1c802ff504ac3c32cb
Signed-off-by: Marcin Piwowarczyk <m.piwowarczy@samsung.com>

commit_message:
Execute functional test jobs running under python3

Functional tests are executed by trovestack script, which uses python
in default OS version which is 2.7.

This change wraps python in tox and executes trovestack int_tests in
virtual enviroment, starting them in python3.

Any future python version change could be managed by tox framework.

Change-Id: I3a849978241d3d0669ef9e1c802ff504ac3c32cb
Signed-off-by: Marcin Piwowarczyk <m.piwowarczy@samsung.com>

subject: functional: bump flavor specs
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-09 05:35:44.000000000', 'message': "functional: bump flavor specs

We have VMs with 8 cores and 8GB of memory, this patch makes better
use of them by adding more cores (which shouldn't have much of a
negative impact) as CPU is not fully used during test runs.

This should hopefully improve performance of the functional tests.

Change-Id: Ib79a8c83758628286c68e941024de5bc2741b088
"}]
commit_message:
functional: bump flavor specs

We have VMs with 8 cores and 8GB of memory, this patch makes better
use of them by adding more cores (which shouldn't have much of a
negative impact) as CPU is not fully used during test runs.

This should hopefully improve performance of the functional tests.

Change-Id: Ib79a8c83758628286c68e941024de5bc2741b088

subject: Remove unused simplejson dependencyfrom lower-constraints
messages:
[{'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-12-11 20:08:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-12-12 09:33:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I created lower-constraints env with the latest horizon and compared the output of pip freeze with lower-constraints.txt. http://paste.openstack.org/show/737116/
simplejson is installed, so there is no need to drop simplejson from lower-constraints.txt.

lower-constraints.txt is used to control python package versions which horizon depends on *indirectly* too, so I believe it is no problem that simplejson in lower-constraints.txt.

On the other hand, I see several packages which are not really used in http://paste.openstack.org/show/737116/.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-12-14 17:46:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I don't see any benefit of having indirect dependencies in any of requirements.txt because of we can't control them in most cases."}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-12-14 22:25:16.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

Change-Id: I1927650cbc81150e9e94fadf4a443a65e0c209ae
'}]

commit_message:
Add CLI scripts from osken to be installed via setup.cfg

Instead of keeping hardcoded files in bin/ directory it is
more flexible to install such files using setup.cfg file.
It will for example install files with correct shebang for
python2 and python3.

This patch also removes tools/osken-manager.spec file
as it was used by PyInstaller in Ryu and it isn't used
in os-ken.

Change-Id: Ie85c64d81c86f0059528ad4d8e238a4124d4e5b4

subject: Fix access to /var/lib/haproxy when SELinux is enabled
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'shardy@redhat.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 11391, 'name': 'Mikhail Fedosin', 'email': 'mfedosin@redhat.com', 'username': 'fedosinme'}, {'_account_id': 13039, 'name': 'Martin André', 'email': 'm.andre@redhat.com', 'username': 'mandre'}, {'_account_id': 18851, 'name': 'Marius Cornea', 'email': 'mcornea@redhat.com', 'username': 'mcornea'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23811, 'name': 'Oliver Walsh', 'email': 'owalsh@redhat.com', 'username': 'owalsh'}, {'_account_id': 28223, 'name': 'Cedric Jeanneret', 'display_name': 'cjeanner (Tengu)', 'email': 'cjeanner@redhat.com', 'username': 'cjeanner'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2018-12-11 12:02:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2018-12-11 12:15:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

hm. don't know why this is needed for docker while it wasn't the case for podman - with that engine, it's just working fine... Probably due to the "setype" of the host directory.

Care to dig a bit more?'}, {'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2018-12-11 14:01:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Cédric, hey!
As I understand it correctly, this issue is related to OpenShift installation.
During the initial deployment we set new context (container_file_t) to the /var/lib/haproxy in keepalived.yaml https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/docker/services/keepalived.yaml#L108
That, from my perspective, allows to configure the container for haproxy. It was tripleo part.
Next step for us is to call openshift-ansible, which resets the context to its initial state, i.e. to haproxy_var_lib_t. I believe it happens here: https://github.com/openshift/openshift-ansible/blob/85de16083a1262f86aaf9c44339ce9d52f92f77d/roles/container_runtime/tasks/package_docker.yml#L159-L163
When this happens, any update to the haproxy configuration leads to an SELinux error.'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2018-12-11 14:37:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hmm ok. We actually DO create the directory here:
https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/docker/services/pacemaker/haproxy.yaml#L288
https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/docker/services/haproxy.yaml#L289

And this is where we set the setype.
The ":z" doesn't change the setype. It just allows to ignore the "selinux context range", aka MLS, which is shown as the fourth element group of the `ls -lZ' output, for instance s0-s0:c0.c255.
The ":z" basically allow to mount the same volume in multiple container. That's all.

So I think this patch has no real value, and you should consider ensuring the setype directly in ansible-openshift instead.'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-12-11 15:22:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Hmm ok. We actually DO create the directory here:
 > https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/docker/services/pacemaker/haproxy.yaml#L288
 > https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/docker/services/haproxy.yaml#L289
 > 
 > And this is where we set the setype.
 > The ":z" doesn't change the setype. It just allows to ignore the
 > "selinux context range", aka MLS, which is shown as the fourth
 > element group of the `ls -lZ' output, for instance s0-s0:c0.c255.
 > The ":z" basically allow to mount the same volume in multiple
 > container. That's all.
 > 
 > So I think this patch has no real value, and you should consider
 > ensuring the setype directly in ansible-openshift instead.

IIUC this patch may have value if we backport to stable/rocky, because we don't set the setype there.
Or alternatively we could backport https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/3eeece2d290eef7ba41e7a82765481fd4e732c12 to stable/rocky?'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2018-12-11 15:27:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> IIUC this patch may have value if we backport to stable/rocky,
 > because we don't set the setype there.
 > Or alternatively we could backport https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/3eeece2d290eef7ba41e7a82765481fd4e732c12
 > to stable/rocky?

ugh... I wouldn't go down that road. Although, maybe it would be OK, since selinux separation isn't active in rocky. So maybe. Although at least one other patch might be needed in the backport in order to correct the "shared" things that are present in the one you linked. And maybe another one then, because it would be too easy without it ;).

Maybe the best thing to do is to ensure, from ansible-openshift, the setype and rights for that specific part, at least for rocky, and remove it for the next one where we have a nice SELinux support directly in tripleo... ?'}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-12-12 01:27:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I tested this patch locally and it fixed the issue reported initially for the haproxy container unable to start during a stack update.'}, {'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2018-12-12 11:56:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Cédric, hi! Actually :z changes the type http://paste.openstack.org/show/737121/ In the example I created a folder in my home dir. Initially it had a default type user_home_t, but after mounting in the container it is container_file_t

After some analysis I understood that issue is simpler, that I thought. By default the folder has type a haproxy_var_lib_t, which forbids any write operations for docker. We need to relabel it to container_file_t, to allow mounting with rw permissions. :z does exactly what we need, so I think the patch is correct.'}, {'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2018-12-12 12:02:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

One update: in master we already relabel the folder here https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/docker/services/keepalived.yaml#L108
I think we need to remove :z suffix there and keep it in docker/services/haproxy.yaml for consistency.
In rocky there is no such suffix anywhere.'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2018-12-12 14:16:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

After a good discussion, it's fine for me :)."}, {'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2018-12-12 14:36:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Need to test one thing quickly'}, {'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2018-12-12 14:50:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2018-12-12 15:02:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2018-12-12 15:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-12-12 15:05:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2018-12-12 21:37:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-12-14 14:55:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2018-12-14 15:17:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/rocky as commit ff5d01309495f6fd53c0225c9932e1a405554e1b'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-11 12:02:25.000000000', 'message': "Fix access to /var/lib/haproxy when SELinux is enabled

Currently we don't use relabeling of the folder when SELinux is enabled.
This leads to the fact that we can not update the configuration of
haproxy during the update, because of missing permissions.

This commit adds the relabeling for the folder, which allows the
container with haproxy to write into it.

Closes-Bug: #1807933

Change-Id: Ie79aed5f5665658ea09e000a4847062e9207e25c
"}, {'created': '2018-12-12 14:50:49.000000000', 'message': "Fix access to /var/lib/haproxy when SELinux is enabled

Currently we don't use relabeling of the folder when SELinux is enabled.
This leads to the fact that we can not update the configuration of
haproxy during the update, because of missing permissions.

This commit adds the relabeling for the folder, which allows the
container with haproxy to write into it.

Closes-Bug: #1807933

Change-Id: Ie79aed5f5665658ea09e000a4847062e9207e25c

Currently we don't use relabeling of the folder when SELinux is enabled.
This leads to the fact that we can not update the configuration of
haproxy during the update, because of missing permissions.

This commit adds the relabeling for the folder, which allows the
container with haproxy to write into it.

Change-Id: Ie79aed5f5665658ea09e000a4847062e9207e25c

commit_message:
Fix access to /var/lib/haproxy when SELinux is enabled

Currently we don't use relabeling of the folder when SELinux is enabled.
This leads to the fact that we can not update the configuration of
haproxy during the update, because of missing permissions.

This commit adds the relabeling for the folder, which allows the
container with haproxy to write into it.

Closes-Bug: #1807933

Change-Id: Ie79aed5f5665658ea09e000a4847062e9207e25c
